subject: RE: [junit] JUnit tests and common resources
msgSnippet: Hi, ... Mocking the remote communication partner was often extremly useful for me. Can you give us some examples why it would be of little value for you. ...
messageBody:
Hi,

> I could mock the serial connection - I understand this, but this is
> not my intention. I see little value in this for many reasons.

Mocking the remote communication partner was often extremly useful for me.
Can you give us some examples why it would be of little value for you.

> I
> want to test the real thing.

What do you mean with "the real thing"?

The combination of your code + the real communication partner?
Then look at J.B.s answer, this is
exactly my experience and worked very well for me

The remote communication partner? I mainly want to test my code
(and not the remote communication partner)
as the protocol for me is usually defined by a third party
and I "just" need to make sure that my code complains to to protocoll.

Bernd
